title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Thursday 1 June 2017 - BBC News
summary: plans to demolish much-maligned car park approved .
pair arrested in modern slavery investigation .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: today 's updates have now finished but local live will return from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: facebook live : bbc radio derby election debate
text: we are live at the university of derby for bbc radio derby 's election debate - featuring candidates for the country 's most marginal seat , derby north .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: east midlands weather update : a dry evening with clear spells
text: it will be a dry evening with some clear spells reaching lows of 14c ( 57f ) .
there will be a warm start to tomorrow morning with some showery rain and possible thunder in the afternoon .
temperatures will reach a high of 21c ( 70f ) on friday .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: cricket : derbyshire name squad for nottinghamshire clash
text: derbyshire have announced their 14-man squad to play nottinghamshire at trent bridge tomorrow .
the squad is : godleman , reece , slater , macdonell , thakor , madsen , hughes , wilson , smit , mendis , taylor , palladino , hemmings , mckerr .
author: Dave Fletcher
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: rugby : tigers bring in tonga star
text: tonga international sione kalamafoni is one of four new signings announced by leicester tigers today .
the 29-year-old , who has played in two world cups , said he was `` delighted '' to have joined `` a big club with a lot of history '' .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: frog island stabbing : victim now stable , police say
text: the victim of a stabbing in leicester city centre yesterday is now in a stable condition in hospital , police have said .
several roads were cordoned off after the man was discovered by a passing police car at the junction of sanvey gate and soar lane at 00:50 .
officers have been carrying out door-to-door enquiries today to try to establish what happened .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police appeal after tram stop 'assault involving knife '
text: police are appealing for witnesses - particularly these three - after a serious assault involving a knife took place at a tram stop .

officers were called to highbury vale tram stop in nottingham at about 20:50 bst on monday 17 april after the assault , which police say took place following a confrontation between a group of people .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crossbow stolen during house break-in
text: a crossbow pistol and bolts were among the items stolen from a house in ilkeston .
the crossbow pistol - a small crossbow with a trigger mechanism - was taken along with a compound bow and arrows .
a 42in black hitachi television , a panasonic lumix dslr camera , and an xbox 360 games console were also taken during the break-in at a property in haddon street , ilkeston .
the house was unoccupied for a number of days around the time of the burglary , which happened at the start of may .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather watcher breaks down while out snapping
text: spare a thought for weather watcher maggie t from east leake .
she was out taking some photos in the sun this afternoon when her car broke down .
despite the setback , she cheerily uploaded this pic with the caption : `` the show must go on ! ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: school to shut for extra week following water damage
text: holgate primary school and nursery in hucknall has been forced to close for an extra week after half-term because of water damage following a fire .
the blaze broke out last friday and although the building was saved , it has been severely affected by the sprinkler system .
it will remain closed until at least friday 9 june .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: kalamafoni & ryan among tigers signings
text: kalamafoni & ryan among tigers signings

documents.title: jewellery stolen from house in ilkeston
text: sentimental jewellery has been stolen from a house in ilkeston .
it was taken from an art-deco style box , which was black with orange birds on it .
the break-in happened at a house in oakwell drive between 09:00 and 17:00 on 24 may .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: further arrests over leicester street 'gunshots '
text: two more people have been arrested on sus of firearms offences following reports of gunshots on a residential street in leicester .
police said a 17-year-old youth and an 18-year-old man were questioned yesterday over the incident in tolton road on 21 may before being released pending further enquiries .
despite the reports of shots , nobody was found injured and no local hospitals dealt with injuries relating to gunshot wounds .
four other people - a 22-year-old man and three 16 year olds - were previously arrested on sus of firearms offences and also released pending further investigation .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: green light for broadmarsh centre redevelopment
text: this is how the revamped broadmarsh car park and bus station will look when it opens in late 2019 .
the city council plans to create a pedestrian area between the shopping centre and the railway station with a new car park entrance in canal street .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingbroadmarsh car park to be knocked down
text: nottingham city council has given the demolition of the broadmarsh centre car park and bus station the go-ahead .
work to build a replacement is expected to be completed by late 2019 .
the council said it would be running a competition to offer a local person the chance to get the demolition under way next month .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pic appeal over football fight in derbyshire pub
text: photos have been released of several men police want to speak to about a clash between football supporters at a pub in derbyshire .
the men , who are thought to be birmingham city supporters , fought with cardiff city fans at the royal oak in barlborough ahead of away games for both sides on 14 april .
the birmingham city fans were on their way to rotherham united and the cardiff city fans were heading to sheffield wednesday .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: spireites star attracts interest from other clubs
text: we understand reports of interest in chesterfield forward kristian dennis are true .
no concrete offers made though and the club is unwilling to sell .
author: Andy Giddings
Sports Editor, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: cycle race road closure details released
text: the women 's tour cycle race will be passing through warwickshire on friday , 9 june .
you can find a full list of road closures on the warwickshire county council website .
you can find details of road closures in # kenilworth and # leamingtonspa for the women 's tour on friday 9 june here
congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 25th for jun 1 . )

documents.title: daily express : foxes could get £ 50m for mahrez
text: leicester city 's riyad mahrez could be set for a move to arsenal - with the foxes receiving a whopping £ 50m for his services , according to today 's daily express .
read more in bbc sport 's football gossip column .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : summer in derbyshire
text: this remarkable photo was sent to bbc east midlands today 's facebook page by sharon jackson from duffield .
great shot , sharon .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cyclist seriously injured in loughborough crash
text: a cyclist is in a critical condition after being involved in a crash with a car in loughborough last night .
the collision happened in epinal way , close to the forest road junction , at about 21:00 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derbyshire 's new chief constable takes charge
text: it 's the first day in the role for derbyshire 's new chief constable peter goodman .
goodman , who was deputy to retiring chief constable mick creedon , was welcomed by the county 's police and crime commissioner hardyal dhindsa .
he 's identified tackling cyber crime as one of his top priorities and said he hoped for a `` long and successful partnership with derbyshire residents '' .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : bbc radio nottingham 's election debate
text: you can hear bbc radio nottingham 's one-hour election debate in full below .
mark dennison was joined by kat boettge ( green party ) , chantal lee ( labour ) , fran loi ( ukip ) , mark spencer ( conservative ) and robert swift ( lib dem ) .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest weather outlook
text: cloud will build this afternoon but there 'll still be some sunny spells with light winds and highs of 23c ( 73f ) .
we 're then expecting a dry and warm night with lows of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: forest 'not fit for purpose ' - randall
text: forest 'not fit for purpose ' - randall

documents.title: stolen car set on fire in leicester park
text: crews had to deal with a car fire in leicester 's western park this morning .
the fire service said the car was believed to have been stolen and set on fire deliberately .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: election debate : 'end nhs profiteering '
text: kat boettge , from the green party , tells the bbc radio nottingham election debate she wants to stop nhs money ending up in the pockets of private firms .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: broadmarsh centre car park could be demolished
text: a decision will be made this afternoon on the fate of the broadmarsh centre car park in nottingham .
nottingham city council is considering demolishing the car park and building a replacement , with work set to last until the end of 2019 .
it 's not yet clear where the new parking spaces will be - or the bus station , which carries hundreds of services each day .

the council said intu , broadmarsh 's owners , was making good progress `` towards delivering the major redevelopment of the shopping centre , with full construction likely to begin at the end of the year '' .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pest controller looks to clear up wasp/bee confusion
text: a pest controller from derbyshire says he 's been getting lots of call-outs from people confusing wasps with bees .
pete bancroft , from south derbyshire district council , says he removed about 500 wasp nests last year but never gets involved with bees .
he told bbc radio derby : `` we wo n't kill the bees - we 'll let them go , have a life .
after a few weeks they 'll just go .
`` we always get the bees come first [ in the year ] .
they always come about a month or six weeks before wasps do .
people see something buzzing about and think it 's a wasp - but in may time it never is .
it 's too early . ''
author: Jonathan Baker
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: election debate : 'we want to end landbanking '
text: liberal democrat robert swift tells bbc radio nottingham 's election debate his party would stop developers buying up vacant land with no intention of building on it .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: volunteers ' week 2017
text: organisations and charities across the region are celebrating volunteers ' week .
the week runs from today until 7 june to celebrate the hard work and dedication of people who give up their time to help others .
pcc @ twitterid welcomes opportunity to recognise all that @ twitterid volunteers do .
# volunteersweek2017
not left until the # volunteersweek on 1st june we 'd like to say a huge thank you to all of our # volunteers !
thank you to our super amazing volunteers & peer mentors .
you 're doing fantastic work for us & making a difference # volunteersweek
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes skipper dreaming of champions league return
text: leicester city captain wes morgan has said he thinks the foxes are capable of reaching the champions league again .
he told the official club website : `` everyone knows how good we can be when we play at our best .
if we do , we can compete in the top half and maybe in the top eight .
that 's where we need to aim to play .
`` hopefully one day , we can get into a champions league spot again . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: election debate : 'more could be done in terror fight '
text: ukip 's fran loi tells bbc radio nottingham 's election debate the government could be doing more to round up suspected extremists .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: appeal for information after assault
text: police are appealing for information in connection with an assault in jubilee square , leicester .
a 23-year-old suffered a fractured jaw after being attacked at about 01:00 bst on sunday 30 april and police say a group of men spotted on cctv may have information about what happened .
it 's believed the men may have been at the leicester tigers v sale sharks match earlier in the day .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: election debate : may correct on brexit ?
text: conservative mark spencer was asked whether theresa may 's negotiating stance on brexit was right .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: election debate : should the elderly pay other people 's council tax ?
text: labour 's chantal lee shared her views on the question about why older people - who already pay for their own home care - have to pay for others through their council tax .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rail passengers warned to expect crowded carriages
text: if you 're getting a train today you might find it has fewer carriages than usual .
east midlands trains says this is because it has a higher than usual number of trains needing `` essential maintenance '' so some services are expected to be more crowded .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : derbyshire bring in fast bowler
text: ahead of their trip to trent bridge tomorrow , derbyshire 's bowling attack just got a bit quicker , and a bit younger .
they 've signed 19-year-old conor mckerr from surrey on a month-long loan .
he 's likely to make his debut against notts tomorrow with quick bowlers hardus viljoen and will davis both out .
author: Owen Bradley
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: radio nottingham : election debate
text: you can hear bbc radio nottingham 's election debate this morning - candidates standing in five nottinghamshire constituencies answered questions from voters .
the hustings at the national justice museum is on air now .
we 'll also bring you some short clips from each candidate this morning .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: father murderer 'was merciless '
text: yesterday , daniel seggie from mackworth in derby was jailed for a minimum of 20 years for the murder of his father geoff , who he killed at the home they shared .
det con insp emlyn richards , who led the investigation , has described it as a `` merciless killing '' and says the 31-year-old has never explained his motives .
seggie 's trial heard how he carried out the `` vicious assault '' in his father 's bedroom , using a knife and hammer .
he then tried to cover his tracks , making calls from his father 's phone and lying to his own family .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: people encouraged to enjoy the outdoors this month
text: for the next 30 days , the nottinghamshire wildlife trust is encouraging people to explore and enjoy nature .

nationally more than 40,000 businesses , schools and individuals have signed up for the project , called 30 days wild - which can involve anything from a walk at a nature reserve to simply walking around barefoot on the grass .
the trust has been working with the university of derby to prove that spending time in nature is good for people .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: two arrested in modern slavery investigation
text: two people have been arrested in nottingham as part of an investigation into modern slavery .
a 42-year-old man and a 39-year-old woman were detained after a raid in hyson green yesterday - on sus of human trafficking , and fraud by false representation .
a 57-year-old man , who was found at the address , is being given specialist support .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east midlands weather forecast
text: a dry and bright day in store with some cloud but a good amount of sunshine
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: travel : latest on east midlands ' roads
text: travel : latest on east midlands ' roads
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live updates
text: good morning everyone .
it looks set to be another sunny day .
gavin bevis and myself will provide today 's news , sport , travel and weather updates for the east midlands .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live
